description: From Middle English angler, angleer, angeler, equivalent to angle +â€Ž -er.

entries.meaning: A person who fishes with a hook and line.
examples: A throng of anglers lined the trout stream on opening day of trout season.
The angler lured a smaller fish into reach with the appendage on its head.

entries.meaning: Someone who tries to work an angle; a person who schemes or has an ulterior motive.
examples: Jonas was a consummate angler when it came the company's leave policy; he had it figured so he only needed to work six months out of the year.

entries.meaning: (archaic, UK, thieves' cant) A thief who uses a hooked stick to steal goods out of shop-windows, grates, etc.
